metadata.metaValue: editable=false;items={"Double Side"=0;"Half Side"=1;"Start Side"=2;"End Side"=3;"No Side"=4}

These are all QUAD faces,
so I don't check the number of points
Super simple fast - just use face normal

0 = Direction Vector
1 = Longest Edge
2 = Shortest Edge
3 = Point Index
4 = Alignment
Local horizontal axis of the face
Fixed size, cut only for the extend of the selected edge
moves and rotates faces from their position/orientation to the origin so that they lie flat in XZ with "down" pointing in +Z

calculates sizes to fix the ratio between inner and outer.
Works only with fixed subdivisions.
items={"Double Side"=0;"Half Side"=1;"Start Side"=2;"End Side"=3;"No Side"=4}

Modes:

0 = double
1 = half
2 = start
3 = end
4 = none

Flex Modes:

0: Inner
1: Outer
2: Both
3: None
If there are NO subdivs or not enough space for fixed subdivs then collapse to the start component
items={"Double Side"=0;"Half Side"=1;"Start Side"=2;"End Side"=3;"No Side"=4}

Mode 3 (None flexible) uses the default of the switch node =
0 for both
Whats the rest after this subdiv?
Special case: the polygon lies left or right of all cuts
Add the last element to the array
If the polygon is between two cuts -> find the cut to the left
If there are NO subdivs, set the type to the FLEXIBLE component
